page.title: 02"Eccleshill",Bradford
page.content: 1.The hill the village stood on was covered with forest which reached as far as the parish church in Bradford.It was probably called {"Eagle's Hill".} 2.Another theory is that the name came from the word{'eclesia'}which means church in latin.A church may have stood on the hill.Human bones have been found which suggests a graveyard. 3.There is a theory that it might have been named after an{Anglo-Saxon } settler called{Eckil.}The owner of the next manor of Bolton was Archil, who might have been Eckil's brother. We thought the second explanation was best because of bones being found. {Eccleshill}had three carucates of land as described in the{Domesday Book compiled in 1086.A carucate was as much land as a team of oxen ploughed in a year.
